name: plastic granulate production, unspecified, recycled, formal sector | plastic granulate, unspecified, recycled | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22026/documentation

The formal plastic recycling sector in India contributes to a comparatively smaller percentage of the overall plastic recycling of the country in comparison with the informal sector. Once the received plastics are segregated, cleaned and sorted, the plastics are ground into smaller flakes. The grinding phase generally comprises of shredders that reduce bulk plastics into smaller flakes. The formal sector in India uses extrusion machines for pelletization, and separate moulding machines for moulding and colouring of plastics from e-waste. Visited formal recyclers were from different parts of the country based out of Pune, Bangalore, Hyderabad. Electricity is obtained from the grid. Data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers and on-site visits were carried out. Information provided was verified and actual readings were taken related to electrical energy consumption the formal sector. The dataset is representation of production of plastic pelletes through the process of extrusion.

This dataset include activities that occur after the shredded or ground plastic material is received for pelletization.

This dataset includes activities until the received shredded or ground waste plastics is pelletized, moulded and/or coloured.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The recycling sector has been following this method for several years. There is no anticipated change in the next few years in their method of working. However, with the new e-waste rules in the country, bringing in more focus on sustainable recycling, certain changes are expected to occur over a period of time.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The geography included for the formal sector includes the leading formal plastic recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology that is used in the formal sector is standard and is uniformly adopted by all the formal recyclers. The equipment is maintained and is not of very old technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The geography included for the formal sector is a wide representation of formal recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: An initial data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers. On-site visits were carried out and data were collected from leading recyclers in the formal recycling sector. Information provided was verified and readings were taken for information that is unavailable with the formal sector.These recyclers were engaged into recycling of plastics mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc.Data collected from different recyclers was compiled in the excel sheets and analysed. All the data were aggregated to per 1000 kgs of production of plastic granules/pellets.

VOC emissions emitted during the extrusion process. The results are obtained by conducting VOC emisison sampling by activated sorbet method by SGS India Pvt Ltd Laboratory.

flow.name: Carbon tetrachloride
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Electricity consumed for extrusion process. The value is calculated based on specific energy numbers of some of the imported machine (350 - 500 kWh/ton) and locally manufactured extruder machines (150 - 200 kWh/ton), and on the actual measurements. Weighted average of the numbers has been worked out. The weighted averages are calculated assuming 30% weightage on actual measurement, 30% weightage of extruders are basic, locally manufactured while 40% are imported ones. The value was calculated as a weighted average due to lack of information. The value is based on discussions with experts and recyclers as well as literature.
